text: Kim Dong-Hyun (born 20 May 1984) is a South Korean professional athlete. He is best known as an association football player. He was a member of the Korean national team.NationalFootballTeams.com, Kim Dong-Hyun; retrieved 2012-9-9. == Club statistics == Club performance Club performance Club performance League League Cup Cup League Cup League Cup Continental Continental Total Total Season Club League Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Japan Japan Japan League League Emperor's Cup Emperor's Cup J.League Cup J.League Cup Asia Asia Total Total 2003 Oita Trinita J1 League 1 0 0 0 0 0 - 1 0 South Korea South Korea South Korea League League KFA Cup KFA Cup League Cup League Cup Asia Asia Total Total 2004 Suwon Samsung Bluewings K-League 24 3 0 0 2 1 - 26 4 2005 17 4 3 0 12 2 6 1 38 7 Portugal Portugal Portugal League League Taça de Portugal Taça de Portugal Taça da Liga Taça da Liga Europe Europe Total Total 2005–06 Braga Portuguese Liga 13 1 1 0 - 0 0 14 1 Russia Russia Russia League League Russian Cup Russian Cup Premier League Cup Premier League Cup Europe Europe Total Total 2006 Rubin Kazan Russian Premier League 4 1 0 0 - 2 0 6 1 Korea Republic Korea Republic Korea Republic League League FA Cup FA Cup K-League Cup K-League Cup Asia Asia Total Total 2007 Seongnam Ilhwa Chunma K-League 25 5 1 0 1 0 10 5 37 10 2008 21 1 3 0 9 3 - 33 4 2009 Gyeongnam FC 12 1 0 0 3 0 - 15 1 2010 Gwangju Sangmu / Sangju Sangmu Phoenix 16 3 3 1 3 0 - 22 4 2011 6 0 1 0 4 2 - 11 2 Country Japan Japan 1 0 0 0 0 0 - 1 0 Country Korea Republic Korea Republic 121 17 11 1 34 8 16 6 182 32 Country Portugal Portugal 13 1 1 0 - 0 0 14 1 Country Russia Russia 4 1 0 0 - 2 0 6 1 Total Total Total 139 19 12 1 34 8 18 6 203 34 == National team statistics == === Statistics === Korea Republic national team Korea Republic national team Korea Republic national team Year Apps Goals 2004 1 0 2005 3 0 2006 2 1 Total 6 1 === Goals === :Results list South Korea's goal tally first.
